CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week.... What Does 'License' Mean to Liquor Control Board? 1951 Liquor Laws Governing State Liquor Control Board - Homewood Methodist Church..face-to-face does one behold this in Homewood."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 29, 1958, pg. 6, reads: "'Main Street's' Four - Homewood Ave., the 'Main Street' which dissects the Homewood area, has several liquor dispensing establishments, including... (bottom left): Brusco's... - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Homewood Avenue with Homewood Methodist Church on left and Brusco's Bar and Carlos Cleaners and Tailors on right, and painted sign in background for Finance Realty Company, Homewood
